wikipedia_page.main: Robert "Bob" Roberts (July 1864 – 15 March 1932) was a Welsh professional footballer who played at wing half for several clubs, spending most of his career with Bolton Wanderers in the English Football League. He made a total of ten appearances for Wales.

response: *Robert Roberts (Queensland politician) (1869–1934), Australian politician for East Toowoomba between 1912 and 1934
*Robert Roberts (American politician) (1848–1939), mayor of Burlington, Vermont

*Robert Roberts (butler) (1780–1860), author of The House Servant's Directory: A Monitor for Private Families
*Robert Roberts (Christadelphian) (1839–1898), Scottish journalist, writer and preacher
*Robert Roberts (author) (1905–1974), British author of The Classic Slum
* Robert Roberts (footballer, born 1864) (1864–1932), known as Bob Roberts, Welsh midfielder
